job_title: Programmer Analyst in Sioux City, IA
pros: Morningside College is a very relaxed environment. The staff is always friendly and workable. One of the benefits is free tuition for my family.
cons: The campus is really quiet during the summer months and you can't interact with the students. The students are the reason I work there!

review_title: Small, private college having an identity crisis - being run like a for-profit school
job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Sioux City, IA
pros: The school is in a small town, if you like that sort of thing.  Easy commute. The people are friendly, and there are some really dedicated teachers.  Almost every professor and adjunct there is passionate about teaching.
cons: The school is over-priced. I could not feel proud of our product (the education we were providing to our students). The teachers are undercompensated and felt very insecure.  Whole departments in the humanities were laid off (even tenured professors) because the school is trying reinvent itself as a more technical college. New, full-time professors were being hired WITHOUT benefits. I was being paid so little, I couldn't afford to work there anymore.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Sioux City, IA
pros: Awesome School great atmosphere. The professors really know how to get on a personal level with the students and over all i really enjoyed my time.
cons: The surrounding city is questionable at best. The air quality and water quality are not to great and it seems like the people here are a bit hostile towards outsiders.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Sioux City, IA
pros: As an adjunct professor, I can work on my own timeline.  The workload allows me to work full time and still get experience at the next level.
cons: The only con is not being able to work face to face with the students that I teach.
